bibl.title: Letter from George Packer Berry to William W. Caswell, Jr., November 29, 1952

div1.p: Berry hopes that Caswell will be able to represent Harvard at the Camp Lazear dedication, but is sending official greetings from Harvard to Hench, to convey to the Cubans, in case Caswell cannot attend. On the same page, a note from Berry to Hench congratulates him on skillfully planning this event.

div1.head: Letter from George Packer Berry to William W. Caswell, Jr., November 29, 1952
div1.p:
COPY
HARVARD MEDICAL SCHOOL
OFFICE OF THE DEAN
25 SHATTUCK STREET
BOSTON, MASSACHUSETTS
November 29, 1952 AIR MAIL SPECIAL DELIVERY

Mr. William W. Caswell, Jr.
First National Bank of Boston
Havana, Cuba

Against the possibility that you may not be able to
act as Harvard's representative at the ceremony establishing
the memorial park on the site of Camp Lazear, I am sending
our official greetings to His Excellency, Dr. Enrique Saladrigas
y Zayas, El Ministro de Salubridad y Asistencia Social, to
Dr. Philip S. Hench in care of the Hotel Nacional, with the
request that he pass them along to you in the event that you
serve as Harvard's representative or present them to His
Excellency on our behalf if you cannot.

Hoping that you can find the time to represent Harvard
on this important occasion which has such potential for inter-
national goodwill, I am

Sincerely yours,
George Packer Berry, M.D.
Dean
cc: Dr. Hench

Dear Doctor Hench:
You will find this note self-explanatory. I wish I could
be with you. Do let me congratulate you again on the significant
event that your enthusiasm and skillful planning have made possible.
